references.paper_title: Blended diffusion for text-driven editing of natural images
references.reason: This paper is foundational for the proposed method, providing a technique for seamlessly integrating diverse objects into any scene, crucial for the affordance-aware object insertion task.
This is a foundational paper in image editing and inpainting, which is relevant to image composition and object insertion, key aspects of the current work.

references.paper_title: Diffusion models beat gans on image synthesis
references.reason: This paper demonstrates the superior performance of diffusion models over GANs in image synthesis, a critical component of the proposed MADD model.
This paper provides the SAM model, a foundation for the large-scale SAM-FB dataset used in this study, which is vital for training a robust model for affordance-aware object insertion.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces the Stable Diffusion model, a key component of the proposed method, facilitating high-quality image synthesis and seamless object integration, vital for achieving realistic image compositions.
